title: Los Angeles Southwest College
text:
Los Angeles Southwest College (LASC) is a <a href="Public%20college">public</a> <a href="community%20college">community college</a> in the <a href="unincorporated%20area">unincorporated area</a> of <a href="West%20Athens%2C%20California">West Athens, California</a> in <a href="Los%20Angeles%20County">Los Angeles County</a>, <a href="California">California</a>. It is part of the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Community%20College%20District">Los Angeles Community College District</a> and its service area includes Inglewood, Hawthorne, Gardena, Unincorporated Westmont, and West Athens.
History.
Los Angeles Southwest College was established in 1967, two years after the <a href="Watts%20riots">Watts Rebellion</a>, in response to complaints of both officials and citizens that not enough was being done to educate the area's mostly African American population. The college, located at the intersection of <a href="Western%20Avenue%20%28Los%20Angeles%29">Western Avenue</a> and <a href="Imperial%20Highway">Imperial Highway</a>, is the only community college in <a href="South%20Los%20Angeles">South Central Los Angeles</a>.
LASC has secured over $500 million of bonds to complete its master facilities master plan by 2025. As a "green campus", LASC has a college-wide recycling program and will have the majority of its building meeting some level of LEED standard.
